header.gameNote: SOUTHERN CONF TR AT NORTH CHARLESTON SC

article.headline: The Citadel 65, Furman 53
article.story: NORTH CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- J'Mel Everhart had 12 of his 18 points in the second half and last-place Citadel kept its season alive with a 65-53 victory over Furman in the Southern Conference tournament Thursday night. The Bulldogs (10-20) were 0-14 in the league this year before their only conference victory, an 84-80 overtime win at Wofford last Saturday. Now, they've advanced to the tournament quarterfinals for the first time since 2002. Citadel faces No. 3 seed Davidson on Friday. Some solid 3-point shooting in the first half and Everhart's inside play down the stretch were big reasons why. Dante Terry had three of the Bulldogs seven 3-pointers in the first half as they led 31-23 at the break. Then, after Furman (15-13) rallied to lead 40-39, Everhart scored 11 points in Citadel's 16-4 run that put the game away. Donny McLendon's basket started the surge and put the Bulldogs in front to stay. Then Everhart had two baskets and a pair of foul shots. McLendon added another field goal, Vytautas Valiulis two free throws and Everhart closed things with a three-point play as Citadel was up 56-44. When Everhart slid through several defenders for the basket, Citadel cadets and alumni at the North Charleston Coliseum cheered loudly. The sixth-seeded Paladins came in a big favorite to advance -- they beat Citadel twice this year by scores of 81-57 and 64-41. But after shooting less than 35 percent (8-for-23) in the opening period, they did even worse after halftime to finish 30.4 percent (17-for-56) for the game. Robby Bostain led Furman with 13 points, but had only four in the second half. Eric Webb finished with 12 points, but shot just 1 of 8 after halftime before fouling out. McLendon had 14 points for the Bulldogs, while Terry added 13.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
